title: Who was Benazir Bhutto? - Quora
tags: Politicians and Government Leaders of Pakistan

response.answer_text: Benazir Bhutto was the first female Prime Minister of Pakistan and the Islamic World.  He was the first daughter of Zulfiqar Ali Bhutto. She received her early education in Karachi and then moved to the US for higher education. Z.Bhutto (father of Benazir) founded the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) and became the first civil martial law administrator of Pakistan as well as the president in 1972. In 1973, Pakistan got its current constitution and Z.Bhutto was elected as the Prime Minister. In 1977, Zia-ul-Haq imposed military martial law in Pakistan arresting Bhutto. Bhutto was hanged in 1979 with the allegation of murder. During Zia era, Benazir and her family mostly remained in jail or under house arrest. In 1984, under foreign pressure, Zia allowed Bhutto family to move to UK where they remained in exile until.In 1988, Zia died in a plane crash. General elections were held in Pakistan and PPP won majority. Benazir as the leader of PPP become the first female elected prime minister of Pakistan (or any Islamic country).In 1990, President Ghulam Ishaq dismissed the parliament. Elections were held and Islami Jamhoori Ittehad (IJI) won the election. Benazir become the Leader of the opposition.In 1993, President Ghulam Ishaq again dismissed the IJI government and elections were held again. Benazir become prime minister for second term after gaining the simple majority in electionIn 1996, Benazir close ally, President Farooq Leghari dismissed her government. B.Bhutto become Opposition Leader for a second term.In 1999, Chief of Army Staff (CoAS), Pervez Musharraf, implemented martial law and dismissed the parliament. B.Bhutto supported Musharraf behind the scene. This allowed PPP to fill the political gap created after the martial law.In 2002 elections, PPP won majority seats but many leader splitted from the party forming their own faction and joined hand with Musharaf supported PMLQ to form federal government. During all those years, Benazir remained outside Pakistan, mostly in Dubai and London. She lead his party from their and remained an important part of Pakistani politics.She returned to Pakistan on October 2007 despite the life threats she was facing. AND she got assassinated on December 27 after addressing a political rally at Rawalpindi.Assassination of Benazir Bhutto Benazir Bhutto (After her death, general elections got delayed for a month and her party won a majority in 2008 elections)

Benazir Bhutto was a Muslim, Pakistani politician which served as Head of State twice before getting assassinated. She was the daughter of slain Prime Minister of Pakistan Zulfiqar Ali Bhutto. She enjoyed iconic position due to the fact that she was First Ever democratically elected female Muslim head of state. She married Asif Ali Zardari (ex-president of Pakistan) and had 2 daughters and one son. She was an oxford graduate and the author 3 of books. Daughter of Destiny: An Autobiography,Daughter of the East,and Reconciliation: Islam, Democracy, and the West.She was killed in Rawalpindi in December 2008 while she was returning from her election campaign rally.
